modules.description: This module provides a `draw` function that renders images using Cairo graphics by applying a custom drawing operation to an image buffer. It works with 8-bit grayscale or RGB images represented as `Bimage.Image.t` values. Use this to overlay vector graphics or annotations directly onto image data in a GTK-compatible format.

This module manages the creation and manipulation of image display windows with event handling for mouse, keyboard, and timer actions. It works with RGB image data represented as 8-bit integer arrays and window objects that can be updated, resized, or destroyed. Concrete use cases include interactive image processing tools, real-time visualization of image data, and GUI-based image analysis applications.

This module enables interactive image display and annotation by combining low-level image rendering with window management and event handling. It operates on 8-bit grayscale or RGB images stored as `Bimage.Image.t` and supports dynamic window updates, user input, and custom drawing operations. You can use it to build GUI applications for real-time image processing, annotate images with vector graphics, or visualize image data with interactive controls. Example applications include image viewers with zoom and pan, annotation tools, and interactive analysis interfaces.
